column4: My wireless (broadcom 4306, driver installed via restricted drivers manager) quit working after the most recent kernel update, any ideas?
easy go what to previous kernel... dont use propposed updates
I just installed it when it came up in the update manager, I didn't use any beta anything.
Do I need to do something special to update my kernel to -19? It's not showing up as an update.
I did apt-get update and apt-get upgrade
System --> Administration --> Software Sources check if you have selected correct repos
What would be the correct repos?
IdleOne, Yeah, I've got all of them, but if argento thinks kernel -19 will fix it I can wait.
I guess it's just not showing up for me right now, but I'm sure it will soon.
